com.tinkerpop.gremlin.process

Interface TraversalStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTraversalStrategy, ChooseLinearStrategy, ComparingRemovalStrategy, DedupOptimizerStrategy, EngineDependentStrategy, HadoopElementStepStrategy, IdentityRemovalStrategy, LabeledEndStepStrategy, LocalRangeStrategy, MatchWhereStrategy, Neo4jGraphStepStrategy, ReducingStrategy, SideEffectCapStrategy, TinkerElementStepStrategy, TinkerGraphStepStrategy, TraverserSourceStrategy, UnionLinearStrategy, UnrollJumpStrategy, UntilStrategy

    public interface TraversalStrategy
    A TraversalStrategy defines a particular atomic operation for mutating a Traversal prior to its evaluation. Traversal strategies are typically used for optimizing a traversal for the particular underlying graph engine. Traversal strategies implement Comparable and thus are sorted to determine their evaluation order. A TraversalStrategy should not have a public constructor as they should not maintain state between applications. Make use of a singleton instance() object to reduce object creation on the JVM.
    Author:
    Marko A. Rodriguez (http://markorodriguez.com), Matthias Broecheler (me@matthiasb.com)
